ਉੱਚ ਪ੍ਰਾਪਤੀ ਵਾਲੇ ਵਿਦਿਆਰਥੀ ਕਿਸੇ ਨੂੰ ਦੱਸੇ ਬਿਨਾਂ ਆਪਣੇ ਆਪ ਗਣਿਤ ਚਿੰਤਾ ਉੱਤੇ ਕਾਬੂ ਪਾ ਲੈਂਦੇ ਹਨ।
ਉੱਚ ਪ੍ਰਾਪਤੀ ਵਾਲੇ ਵਿਦਿਆਰਥੀਆਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਗਣਿਤ ਚਿੰਤਾ ਸਮੇਂ ਦੇ ਨਾਲ-ਨਾਲ ਵਧੇਰੇ ਗੁੰਝਲਦਾਰ ਸਮੱਸਿਆਵਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਹੱਲ ਕਰਨ ਨਾਲ ਘੱਟ ਜਾਂਦੀ ਹੈ।
ਗਣਿਤ ਵਿੱਚ ਉੱਚ ਪ੍ਰਾਪਤੀ ਵਾਲੇ ਵਿਦਿਆਰਥੀਆਂ ਲਈ ਗਣਿਤ ਚਿੰਤਾ ਅਸੰਬੰਧਿਤ ਹੈ।

en.value: Sylvia saw very little of Mortimer as he:
en.comp:
Read the passage given below and answer the questions/ complete the statements that follow by choosing the appropriate options from the given ones.

Of Mortimer she saw very little. Farm and woods and trout streams seemed to swallow him up from dawn till dusk. Once, following the direction she had seen him take in the morning, she came to an open space among nut bushes, which were further shut in by huge yew trees, in the centre of which stood a stone pedestal surmounted by a small bronze figure of a youthful Pan (Greek god of shepherds). It was a beautiful piece of workmanship.

Her attention was, however, held by the fact that a newly cut branch of grapes had been placed as an offering at its feet. Grapes were none too plentiful at her home. Sylvia snatched the bunch angrily from the pedestal. She was filled with annoyance as she strolled slowly homeward, and then gave way to a sharp feeling of something that was near fright; from a thick tangle of bushes a boy’s face was scowling at her, brown and beautiful, with unutterably evil eyes.

It was a lonely pathway; all pathways around her home were lonely for that matter. So she sped forward without waiting to give a closer look at this sudden source of freight. It was not till she had reached her house that she discovered that she had dropped the bunch of grapes in her flight.

‘I saw a youth in the wood today’, she told Mortimer that evening, ‘brown-faced and rather handsome, but a rascal to look at. A gipsy lad, I suppose.’

‘A reasonable theory’, said Mortimer, ‘only there aren’t any gipsies in these parts at present’.

wanted to keep away from her

en.value: What is an oak tree known for?
en.comp:
Read the poem given below and answer the questions/ complete the statements that follow by choosing the appropriate options from the given ones.

It is not growing like a tree

In bulk, doth make Man better be:

Or standing long an oak, three hundred year,

To fall a log at last, dry, bald, and sere:

A lily of a day

Is fairer far in May,

Although it fall and die that night -

It was the plant and flower of Light.

In small proportions we just beauties see:

And in short measures life may perfect be.

It is not growing like a tree

In bulk, doth make Man better be:

Or standing long an oak, three hundred year,

To fall a log at last, dry, bald, and sere:

A lily of a day

Is fairer far in May,

Although it fall and die that night -

It was the plant and flower of Light.

In small proportions we just beauties see:

And in short measures life may perfect be.

en.value: After Green Revolution, India stopped the import of ________.
en.comp:
Read the passage given below and answer the questions/ complete the statements that follow by choosing the appropriate options from the given ones.

The miraculous success achieved by the Green Revolution during the late 1960s, by converting India from grain deficit to wheat and rice surplus producing country, was followed by another grand success in milk production. It has proved to be a boon to the nation, by helping not only in stabilising milk prices to a large extent through increased production of milk, but also by ending India’s dependence on milk imports, apart from generating a regular source of income to the small dairy farmers and others. In 1973, the Gujarat Cooperative Milk Marketing Federation was born to market the milk products produced by Cooperative Milk Unions. Anand Milk Union Limited is symbolic of India’s gloriously successful cooperative dairy industry. 

In 1964, a new development took place in the field of dairy farming in the district of Kaira in Gujarat, when the number of small milk producers’ village societies crossed the number of one hundred as against only two in mid-1940s. In 1946, Sardar Patel took the initiative in forming a cooperative society of small milk producers. After collecting their surplus milk, the society pasteurised it and then sent it to Bombay (now Mumbai) market. To begin with, there were only two village societies with 150 milk producers. They grew slowly, and in the meanwhile, a crusader - Dr. Kurien, appeared on the scene, and injected a new dynamism to dairying in the Kaira district.

The societies faced a situation of glut in milk production during the winter season, which was double or even triple in volume as compared to that of summer. Consequently, they were not able to sell the entire winter season’s production of milk. To overcome this problem, Dr. Kurien planned the establishment of a dairy plant to convert the surplus milk into milk powder to be used during the summer season for increasing the supply of milk.

en.value: Srinivas was living:
en.comp:
Read the passage given below and answer the questions/ complete the statements that follow by choosing the appropriate options from the given ones.

Srinivas found domestic duties an extra burden. What a round of demands. He could clearly see that his wife was being driven to despair by his habits. This was the first time that he was sole in charge of his wife and son, and he found that it gave him a peculiar view of them. All along, in the joint family home, they had been looked after by others, and he had no occasion to view to his wife as a sole dependent. But now he found that it was so with a vengeance. At every turn he found he was violating some principle or other of some domestic duty. “This is going to leave me no time for attending to the paper,” he often reflected. He secretly admired those hundreds and hundreds of people who did so much in the world, in spite of a domestic life, even with many more to make demands upon them. “There is perhaps some technique of existence which I have not understood”, he told himself. “If I get at it I shall perhaps be able to manage things better. Am I such an idiot that I cannot manage these things better?” he often reflected. “Here I am seeking harmony in life, and yet with such a discord at the start of the day itself.” His troubles began then. Somehow his wife didn’t seem to like the idea of his walking up so early and going out for coffee. Why, you have a house, why should you go out for coffee? What will people say if they find the master of the house going out for coffee?”

“You are the master of the house”, he replied jokingly, “so it doesn’t matter if I go out.”

“Don’t joke about it”, she said annoyed with him.

Srinivas found domestic duties an extra burden. What a round of demands. He could clearly see that his wife was being driven to despair by his habits. This was the first time that he was sole in charge of his wife and son, and he found that it gave him a peculiar view of them. All along, in the joint family home, they had been looked after by others, and he had no occasion to view to his wife as a sole dependent. But now he found that it was so with a vengeance. At every turn he found he was violating some principle or other of some domestic duty. “This is going to leave me no time for attending to the paper,” he often reflected. He secretly admired those hundreds and hundreds of people who did so much in the world, in spite of a domestic life, even with many more to make demands upon them. “There is perhaps some technique of existence which I have not understood”, he told himself. “If I get at it I shall perhaps be able to manage things better. Am I such an idiot that I cannot manage these things better?” he often reflected. “Here I am seeking harmony in life, and yet with such a discord at the start of the day itself.” His troubles began then. Somehow his wife didn’t seem to like the idea of his walking up so early and going out for coffee. Why, you have a house, why should you go out for coffee? What will people say if they find the master of the house going out for coffee?”

“You are the master of the house”, he replied jokingly, “so it doesn’t matter if I go out.”

“Don’t joke about it”, she said annoyed with him.

en.value: <span style="">Shyam is a good reader in his mother tongue, Santhali and he learnt French very well. He is able to read in French well now. What is this known as?</span>
What does &lsquo;Innateness&rsquo; in language refer to?

options.value: The voluntary nature of humans in speaking.
The problems faced by children when they begin to speak language.
The natural ability of humans to speak a language.
The thinking of humans before they speak in a language.

en.value: A teacher of class VI divides her class into groups of 5 and assign them tasks for three month to work together to collect ideas, data from various people and on various topics. Later they write a report on them and present it to the class. What is the activity?
How does &lsquo;Input&rsquo; provided by materials become &lsquo;intake&rsquo;?

options.value: Learners attempt to practice the grammatical aspects through drills.
Learners use language in contexts for purposes with understanding.
Learners understand the meaning and reproduce language.
Learners memorize the text and use it later.
(a) is bottom-up process and (b) is top-down process
(b) is bottom-up process and (a) is top-down process

en.value: Ashwin is able to recognize some words in a text and spoken by others but he is not able to use on his own. What category do you include these words?

<span style="">Jeeva while learning the new grammatical form (say, past continuous - was / were + v + ing) is able to connect what he has already learnt (the present continuous - is / are + v + ing). What is this strategy known as?</span>

<p style="">Here is an activity from a classroom.</p>

<p style="">Learners are asked to find the weather report from a newspaper and analyse the weather conditions for the week or the day of major cities and towns. Learners in groups work and analyze the same to present it to the whole class. What strategy of language learning does this task involve?</p>

Bharathi, a teacher collects the errors of learners of class VII and discusses them once in a week and draw their attention to the errors and how they occur. She also asks her learners to reflect on the errors. What does she do?

<p>What type of writing does the following come under?</p>
Imagine you are the character in the story and write a letter to your friend expressing your feelings.

Sanskrit, Tamil, classical languages, Hindi, English and Urdu
Mother tongue, other Indian languages, Sanskrit, foreign language, classical language
Home language / mother tongue, another Indian language, foreign language, classical language

en.value: What is &lsquo;text authenticity&rsquo;?

options.value: Contrived texts developed by textbook authors.
Origin of the text from a context and natural language use.
All the texts and narrative in a textbook.

en.value: Which one of the activities relates to portfolio assessment?

options.value: Teacher notices and records all instances of learning by learners.
Teacher records all the works of learners in order to give points for every activity.
Teacher writes her feed to learners&rsquo; parents in report cards.
Keeping a record of all the activities of her classroom.

en.value: <span style="">A teacher reads out a paragraph of ten sentences to her learners in class VIII and asks them to listen carefully. Learners have to recreate the paragraph based on their listening, but need not write the exact words and phrases. They have to create the paragraph nearer to the one they listened to. What is this activity known as?</span>
A task drops / deletes a word or phrase after sixth or the seventh word. What is this test item known as?
